Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is encrusted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394768) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394768)
